p: By step 4, when the viruses have entered the brain, it is very difficult to detect them as a result of their “hiding” in the cells and being almost invulnerable to immune control [ 6]. The BBB acts as a strong immunological barrier and hampers the migration of leukocytes into the parenchyma, while the BCSF is regarded as a selective gate primarily responsible for immune surveillance in the CNS [ 3].
